name: Jumping Jack (itch) (jgerrie)
description:
"Jumping Jack" is written in Micro Color Basic on my favourite 8-bit computer, and the first computer I ever owned, the TRS-80 Micro Color Computer or MC-10.  Some call it the "Poco" because it is the little brother to the Tandy Color Computer.  It's a budget 8-bit micro along the lines of the Sinclair ZX-81.

The game can be played at my website using Mike Tinnes' TRS-80 MC-10 Emulator. Just select DEFENDER from the cassette menu, and then type RUN in the main screen and hit . Type LIST to see the instructions listed at the end of the program.

The game is inspired by a game from the Sinclair Spectrum.

Source Code: https://github.com/jggames/trs80mc10/tree/master/quicktype/Arcade/JumpJack

Blog Posting: https://jimgerrie.blogspot.com/2021/06/jumping-jack-yet-another-10liner-and.html
